(駒ヶ根) is a quiet city of 30,000 inhabitants in
Komagane draws people mostly because of its superb location close to the

just few kilometers west from the central is an attraction.

The tourist information is across the JR station, a bit right from the supermarket. In Komagane Kogen, there's tourist information in the Komagane Farm's building.
Komagane station is a stop on the JR Iida line. If coming from
, you need to change the train at least once and the last leg with the local train is slow. Fastest connection to
takes 4:15 and costs ¥6410. Using only local trains will cut your costs to around ¥3000, but the travel time increases to more than 6 hours.

Highway bus is by far the best option if you're coming from Tokyo. The trip from Shinjuku takes 3 and half hours and the bus connections are frequent, about once per hour. The buses depart from Keio Highway Bus terminal in Shinjuku, just opposite the main building of Yodobashi Camera. One-way ticket costs ¥3650.

In Komagane the highway bus terminal is a couple of blocks west from the JR station. There are also bus connections to

The most interesting bus line for the traveller is the bus leaving from Komagane JR station, going through Komagane Kogen and terminating at Shirabidaira ropeway station. The bus will depart every half hour between 7am and 5pm and is labeled clearly with a "Komagatake Ropeway Station" sign. Trip from the station to Shirabidaira will cost ¥1000 and to Komagane Kogen ¥410.

value: content=The old Buddhist temple is hidden in lush, green forest. The atmosphere is very calm and relaxing.
directions=Right next door to the Kozenji Temple

content=In the same area as the Kozenji Temple (literally right next door), Komagane Kogen Art Museum features a unique collection of Japanese artists. Different areas (about seven, if this contributor remembers correctly) of the museum hold seven differently themed collections, the contents of which are subject to change. Photography and modern art displays are particularly popular. Along with the Temple, it's a great way to spend an afternoon.

Komagane is a good starting place for hikes in the
mountain range. The ropeway can shorten your climb notably.

value: content=The ropeway whisks you up in 7 minutes from an elevation of 1662 meters to 2612 meters. The views towards Minami Alps (Southern Alps) are great and if you're lucky, you can see the figure of
content=A large department store between the center and the Komagane IC.

Across the station there's a supermarket, aptly named
is a local speciality, and there is something of a competition among the local restaurants as to who makes the best. Consistently coming in at the top is
, a restaurant a few blocks away from the local junior high school. They specialize in

value: content=A beer garden type of restaurant, where you can sample products from the local brewery.

There a couple of simple business hotels near the station, where you can get a bed for around ¥6000. In Komagane Kogen, there are plenty of choices, prices are typically around ¥8,000-10,000 per person.

value: content=A clean youth hostel run by a very friendly couple. Good base for hikes.
